thread.title: Canadian health-care software provider PointClickCare plans to go public in Canada and U.S.

author: Gerrit De Vynck And Doug Alexander
title: Canadian health-care software provider PointClickCare plans to go public in Canada and U.S.
text:

Keep me logged in The bid comes a week after the U.S. Supreme Court upheld subsidies for individuals under President Barack Obama’s signature healthcare law, keeping a large chunk of patients intact under the Medicare and Medicaid programs (Andrei Tchernov/iStockphoto) Canadian health-care software provider PointClickCare plans to go public in Canada and U.S. Gerrit De Vynck And Doug Alexander — Bloomberg News 
Thursday, Sep. 03, 2015 4:41PM EDT 
Last updated Thursday, Sep. 03, 2015 5:52PM EDT 
PointClickCare, a Canadian health-care software provider, filed for an initial public offering in the U.S. and plans to do the same in Canada. 
The Mississauga, Ontario-based company plans to list on the Nasdaq Stock Market under the stock symbol PCLK, and intends to go public on the Toronto Stock Exchange as PCC, according to the prospectus and a statement filed Thursday. connect with us The Globe and Mail Newspaper
